settingsPane.description: Choose (whether or not) to apply Dorimanx App settings on BOOT.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch - load ALL settings from ALL tabs on BOOT (Default: Load).
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot.

button.description: Push this button to manually load ALL settings in case of the master switch is (or already was) OFF and wait for Dorimanx App reload. When the master switch was already ON while phone was booting up, there is no need to use it.
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: Load All

settingsPane.description: Customize the CPU Active Governor for each core.
settingsPane.name: CPU Active Governor

spinner.description: Select the CPU0 governor. Some GOV can be unstable on CPU0, so it's recommended to leave it on ONDEMAND.
spinner.name: Default CPU0 Governor

spinner.description: Select the CPU1 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU1 Governor

spinner.description: Select the CPU2 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU2 Governor

spinner.description: Select the CPU3 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU3 Governor

settingsPane.description: Customize the Touch Boost Control settings to make the phone response match your needs.
settingsPane.name: Touch Boost Controls

spinner.description: Set the Maximum CPU boost frequency every time, when touch is being detected CPU minimum frequency will be locked to selected frequency for time range selected in touch boost duration, in order to reduce LAG and allow fast and smooth operations. Note that too high frequency will use more power (Default: 1.49 GHz).
spinner.name: Touch Boost Frequency

seekBar.description: Set the Touch Boost duration. It's the time that core is locked on minimum frequency that is set as boost frequency. 10 ms is equal to 0.01 sec., so It's Ultra-Fast.
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost duration

seekBar.description: Set the Touch Boost interval. This option determines the time, that touch boost driver will wait before locking minimum frequency again to reduce battery usage and CPU heat. It's Ultra-Fast even on 500 ms (100 ms is equal to 0.1 sec.).
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost Interval

seekBar.description: Set how many cores will be affected by Touch Boost Frequency.
seekBar.name: Affected Cores On Touch Boost

settingsPane.description: Customize the CPU Power Saving settings.
settingsPane.name: CPU Power Controls

seekBar.description: Select CPU governor sample rate which works in Power Save mode. The lower the value is set in here, the faster response you'll get, but quicker battery will be discharged.
seekBar.name: CPU Governor Sample Rate

spinner.description: Select CPU governor power control mode. Power save mode will activate options below so you can set the CPU governor sample rate as you like. When performance mode is selected, CPU governor sample rate is set to 10000 Maximum response and other CPU governor sample rate settings will be ignored.
spinner.name: Power Save Switch

checkbox.description: Power-efficient work queues helps to reduce power consumption at cost of slight performance decrease. By enabling this, PE work queues are used for unbound scheduled works to reduce the load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work only on CPU0.
checkbox.name: Power-efficient Work queues
checkbox.label: Power-efficient Workqueues

checkbox.description: By enabling this setting, kernel will obey only Dorimanx App and sets the frequency selected below. This option works whenever screen is ON or OFF.
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Set the Maximum CPU Frequency for each core separately. Other apps or services won't overcome them.
settingsPane.name: Maximum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum allowed speed for CPU0. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 2.26 GHz).
spinner.name: Max CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum allowed speed for CPU1. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 2.26 GHz).
spinner.name: Max CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum allowed speed for CPU2. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 2.26 GHz).
spinner.name: Max CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Select Maximum allowed speed for CPU3. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 2.26 GHz).
spinner.name: Max CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set the minimum CPU Frequency for each core separately.
settingsPane.name: Minimum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum allowed speed for CPU0. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum CPU0 Speed. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 300 MHz).
spinner.name: min CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum allowed speed for CPU1. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum CPU1 Speed. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 300 MHz).
spinner.name: min CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum allowed speed for CPU2. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum CPU2 Speed. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 300 MHz).
spinner.name: min CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Select minimum allowed speed for CPU3. Note that, it can't be higher than Maximum CPU3 Speed. It works only when CPU-Tweaks is enabled (Default: 300 MHz).
spinner.name: min CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set the Suspend min and Max Frequency for all cores.
settingsPane.name: CPU Suspend Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum Allowed CPU frequency when screen is OFF but phone is awake (cases in which apps holds wake locks, music, radio etc.). It has effect ONLY when screen is OFF. If screen is ON, normal Maximum allowed frequency take place.
spinner.name: MAX Screen OFF CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum allowed CPU frequency when screen is OFF but phone is awake (cases in which any app holds wakelocks, music, radio etc.). It has effect ONLY when screen is OFF. If screen is ON, normal minimum allowed frequency take place.
spinner.name: MIN Screen OFF CPU Frequency

button.description: To access CPU LIVE Stats from kernel, Push The Button.
button.name: CPU LIVE Stats
button.label: Switch to Synapse Controls

settingsPane.description: Kernel ROM thermal service and Intelligent Thermal Kernel driver can be enabled together in this section. It protects device from overheating and breaking down components. Below controls are active for Dual Intelligent Temp Control in case of ROM service die. Kernel will protect phone components from any damage only if Dual Intelligent Temp Control is in use. It's better to leave it as is.
settingsPane.name: CPU Thermal Protection

spinner.description: Select CPU Temp Control driver. Default driver without controls, Dual Intelligent Thermal driver with controls below and ROM thermal control. It'll limit CPU frequency when CPU reaches Maximum set temperature and wait until the temperature decreases below specified level for restoring maximux frequency. By using Default Temp Control you have only one overheat protection ensured by ROM, so if ROM stuck and performs hot boot, there is no protection from overheating and breaking your device! On the other hand you'll get better game performance by using ONE protection (high freq. lasts longer on high temp.), so keep that in mind!
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

seekBar.description: Set the Max CPU temperature allowed before throttling down in order to cool the device down.
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

seekBar.description: Set the number of Frequency Steps when throttling down performs.
seekBar.name: Frequency Step

seekBar.description: Set the Temp Pull Timer intervals. The lower value is set, the more often kernel will check the CPU temp.
seekBar.name: Temp Pull Timer

seekBar.description: Set the Temperature Hysteresis for driver. It calculates temp. differences to exactly adjust the best CPU frequency when CPU is in stress too often. Do NOT reduce below 10°C!
seekBar.name: Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: Set the Thermal Limit Lowest CPU Frequency, 7 = 1.19 GHz, 6 = 1.03 GHz and so on.
seekBar.name: Thermal Limit Lowest Frequency

checkbox.description: Use Immediately Limit Stop. It allows to set Max frequency when heat is not rising. It's stressing the driver, but allows higher performance by adding extra 3°C temp. to the global limit. Use it with caution!
checkbox.name: Immediately frequencies Limit Stop
checkbox.label: Immediately Limit Stop

settingsPane.description: Setup HotPlug CPU Thermal controls by deciding how many cores remains ON when they're overheated. It reduces performance, by getting less cores enabled on higher freq. Others will keep waiting until CPU cools down.
settingsPane.name: HotPlug CPU Thermal Controls

spinner.description: HotPlug CPU Thermal Control Main Switch allows to shutdown cores 1,2,3 and leave only core 0 as main core on it's Max frequency. If this option is disabled, then all CPU cores will be online and operate at lower frequencies, when the temperature is too high.
spinner.name: HotPlug Thermal CPU Control

spinner.description: Set how many cores will stay active on high temp. The more cores will be OFF, the higher frequency you'll get on the other cores. Disabled Cores switches online automatically, when temperature is back to normal. Changes will take effect ONLY on LOW Temp! This option depends on HotPlug CPU Thermal control (must be Enabled above)!
spinner.name: Max online CPU's

seekBar.description: Set HotPlug Maximum temperature on Cores. When temperature reaches defined value, it turns OFF cores from 4 to (set in MAX ONLINE CORE option) in order to cool down the device. It can't be higher than CPU MAX HEAT Control. This option works only with Intelli CPU Cores Control.
seekBar.name: Intelli CORE Max Heat

seekBar.description: Adjust the Core HotPlug Temperature Hysteresis for driver by calculating temperature differences and switching cores ON/OFF. Cores can be brought online if needed. Works only with Intelli CPU Cores Control.
seekBar.name: Core Temperature Hysteresis

settingsPane.description: Setup CPU HotPlug settings and CPU Governors.
settingsPane.name: Global HotPlug

spinner.description: Switch from OLD LG Default HotPlug driver to other custom HotPlug drivers. Note that using Intelligent CPU Thermal Control with Default LG HotPlug is NOT recommended (causing low performance).
spinner.name: Hot Plug Driver

seekBar.description: Select CPU HotPlug sample rate. HotPlug driver will check for CPU load every defined period of time and turn cores ON/OFF when needed. For battery save, it's recommended to set the same value, as in CORE TAB in CPU Governor section. Note that 10 here is 10000 for CPU GOV. For best performance, set in range from 10 to 30.
seekBar.name: CPU HotPlug Sample Rate

spinner.description: Allow HotPlug to be suspended when screen is OFF. When device enters full suspend mode, only one core is half active. But if app holds wakelock, then 3 cores are online. This is for all kernel HotPlugs, but default HotPlug is not supported. After many tests it's best to allow HotPlug to always work, as it will reduce battery drain when playing music with screen is OFF.
spinner.name: Hot Plug Suspend Mode

spinner.description: Set how many cores will be active on a high load for a short period of time (Default: 2 cores for 4 sec.). If you wish to save more power while using MSM or Intelligent HotPlug, then it's best to use one core boost. For performance use DUAL or more cores boost.
spinner.name: Hot Plug CPU Booster

seekBar.description: Set the time duration for keeping cores online on high load. It helps to gain more responsively system on spike load. It's for MSM and INTELLIGENT HotPlugs only. 1000msec equal 1sec (Default: 1000msec).
seekBar.name: CPU Booster Duration

spinner.description: Set number of CPU CORES which will stay online. This mod works with all custom HotPlugs. Default LG HotPlug is not supported. This set is stronger than min cores online below.
spinner.name: Max Cores online

spinner.description: Set the minimum number of CPU cores to be online when screen is ON. By default, we have only one core online when device is in idle. More cores online gives more power, but causes battery drain. Default is NORMAL (one core online + other cores offline until needed).
spinner.name: min Online CPU

settingsPane.description: Select the GPU Governor. After doing some changes, hit button to update GPU Governor.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors And Settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency according to GPU load that system needs - if selected Performance Governor, then the GPU will be at Max frequency all the time (Default: MSM Andreno).
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

button.description: This option updates GPU Governor's changes.
button.name: Update GPU Governor Tuning
button.label: Update GPU Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Maximum frequency only when needed coz some higher frequencies can be unstable! (Default: 450MHz).
spinner.name: Max GPU Speed

spinner.description: Select GPU Minimum frequency when GPU is IDLE - if you set higher than 200 MHz, then the GPU will hold selected frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU min Speed

settingsPane.description: Customize Msm-Adreno-Tz Governor! Use that controls ONLY if Msm-Adreno-Tz is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Controls

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-Tz CAP, must NOT be HIGHER than TARGET value! (Default: 75).
seekBar.name: CAP Value

seekBar.description: Msm-Adreno-tz TARGET, must NOT be LOWER than TARGET value! (Default: 80).
seekBar.name: TARGET Value

spinner.description: Set Control Simple_ramp_threshold and Simple_laziness. If it's set to AUTO, then controls below have no effect.
spinner.name: Msm-Adreno-Tz Extra Controls

seekBar.description: Set how many steps will gov wait on high freq before switching to GPU min speed. Higher you set, more battery will be drained, but smoother UI you'll get (Default: 2).
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

seekBar.description: The higher value is set, the longer GPU freq will stay LOW on GPU load (Default: 6000).
seekBar.name: Simple_Laziness Value

settingsPane.description: Customize Simple_Ondemand Governor. Use this controls ONLY if Simple_Ondemand is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Simple_Ondemand Controls

seekBar.description: When GPU load decreases below Down differential level, then gov reduces GPU frequency to it's min frequency. Must NOT be HIGHER than Up threshold value! (Default: 20%).
seekBar.name: Down differential Value

seekBar.description: When GPU load raises above Up threshold level, then gov raises GPU frequency to it's next frequency step until it reaches Max frequency (must NOT be LOWER than Down differential)! (Default: 60%).
seekBar.name: Up threshold Value

settingsPane.description: Customize Conservative Governor. Use the controls ONLY if Conservative is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Conservative Controls

seekBar.description: When GPU load decreases below Down differential level, then gov. reduces GPU frequency to it's min frequency. Must NOT be HIGHER than Up threshold value! (Default: 20%).
seekBar.name: Down threshold Value

seekBar.description: When GPU load raises above Up threshold level, then gov raises GPU frequency to it's next frequency step until it reaches Max frequency (must NOT be LOWER than Down differential)! (Default: 50%).
seekBar.name: Up threshold Value

settingsPane.description: Customize main sound control apps settings.
settingsPane.name: Sound Controls

spinner.description: Select main gain control app (Default: Dorimanx App).
spinner.name: Main Sound app Selector

checkbox.description: Use High Performance Sound Driver mode. It will produce better sound in cost of increasing CPU power and faster battery discharging, only while using FLAC or other lossless high bitrate audio files with frequency response higher than 44.1kHz. In other cases, this mode remains OFF to preserve power. There is no audible differences for standard MP3 or WMA files up to 320kbps.
checkbox.name: Sound High Performance Mode
checkbox.label: Sound High Performance

settingsPane.description: Customize Headphones, SPEAKER and MIC. settings.
settingsPane.name: Sound Controls

seekBar.description: Control for Headphones LEFT gain volume.
seekBar.name: Headphones Gain LEFT

seekBar.description: Control for Headphones RIGHT gain volume.
seekBar.name: Headphones Gain RIGHT

seekBar.description: Control for InCall small speaker gain volume depends on cortex service (Default: ON). Works only when no headphones are plugged in. If you are calling and screen is OFF for 3 sec., then gain setting is changed to small speaker. When call is finished and screen is ON, (in 10 sec) gain will be restore back to HEADPHONES. The same goes if screen is turned off for 3 sec without call. This control works only if Dorimanx app is set as main gain controller!
seekBar.name: InCall Speaker Gain

seekBar.description: Control for Loud Speaker gain volume. The higher you set, the more loudness you'll get. Be aware about how much gain volume level your hardware can handle!
seekBar.name: Speaker Gain

seekBar.description: Control for Camera recording MIC gain volume.
seekBar.name: Camera MIC gain

seekBar.description: Control for Handset MIC. gain volume on call.
seekBar.name: Handset MIC gain on call

settingsPane.description: Customize I/O settings.
settingsPane.name: I/O Tuning

spinner.description: Set the Maximum number of bytes to read-ahead from device storage (Default: 1024 KiB).
spinner.name: Kilobytes to Read-head

spinner.description: When performance mode MMC I/O is set, write speed will be very fast. But when power save mode is set, write performance will be degraded in order to reduce battery discharging.
spinner.name: MMC Power Usage

button.description: Push Trim Now button in order to speed up Read and Write Access Time. It's good to use it once in a day or two.
button.name: Trim System and Data
button.label: Trim NOW

spinner.description: Set the AWAKE I/O scheduler for internal storage (Default: ZEN).
spinner.name: Default Awake I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: Set the Screen OFF I/O scheduler for internal storage. It depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process (Default: ZEN).
spinner.name: Screen OFF I/O Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Customize memory and OOM (Out Of Memory) prevention settings.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using the profiles below. If you want to set your own OOM tuning via another app or scripts.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: Auto OOM Control

checkbox.description: Adaptive LMK helps to free up RAM faster in case of low RAM and vmpressure is in range from 85-94. Apps will be cleaned from RAM in order to allow smooth operations.
checkbox.name: Adaptive LMK
checkbox.label: Adaptive LMK

seekBar.description: When RAM pressure is higher than set in here, LMK is ordered to release RAM and allow faster load for something BIG into memory. The effect is that apps are loading faster. Lower the value, more apps gets killed. For best performance, keep it in range from 85 to 90%.
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Pressure Range

checkbox.description: It helps to reduce used RAM for each app that is running in a background. When vm memory pressure jumps higher and system needs more RAM for something BIG, then process starts to shrink used RAM by background apps. It's also shrinks the ZRAM swap (if enabled) in order to reduce CPU power usage when RAM is free.
checkbox.name: Process Memory Reclaim
checkbox.label: Process Reclaim

seekBar.description: Control for Max vm pressure for process memory reclaim. It allows to shrink RAM from other apps when vm pressure is in range from 50 to (set here) value. When value is lower that default (90), then less ram shrinks when something BIG should have been be loaded to RAM. It will reduce CPU usage when loading big apps, but loads it slower, as memory should be first freed by LMK.
seekBar.name: Max Process Reclaim Pressure

spinner.description: Set the mode for low memory management (lowmemkiller function) when screen is ON. More aggressive equals more free RAM, but more apps get killed.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Set the mode for low memory management when screen is OFF. More aggressive equals more free RAM, but more apps will be killed.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

spinner.description: Set the low memory reserve ratio mode. Higher ratio gives more free RAM. If you see that your RAM and system is always loaded and device is LAGGING, with less than 280MiB of RAM, then use recommended or high pressure setting. Use relaxed if your free RAM is always above 650MiB.
spinner.name: Low Memory Reserve

seekBar.description: The more is set in here, the more memory will be used as writing buffer for background operations. Buffer will be released when it needs more free RAM.
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: The more is set in here, the more memory will be used for real time operations writing buffer. Buffer will be released when it needs more free RAM.
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

seekBar.description: It controls the tendency of the kernel for reclaiming memory which is used for caching the directory and all the information needed by the kernel to manipulate a file or a directory (inode objects).
seekBar.name: Vfs Cache Pressure

button.description: Release all cached and buffered files from RAM. WAIT approx. 3 sec. for getting cleanup report.
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

settingsPane.description: SWAP control is using swap storage placed in /data folder in order to extend real free RAM for apps working in background. Enable this option only, if you have free space and you really need that RAM extension. You will notice slightly faster battery discharging and I/O read/write operation will be slightly degraded! It can be combined with ZRAM.
settingsPane.name: Linux SWAP

spinner.description: Select SWAP size or keep it OFF, it's take time to create SWAP file, just WAIT till you get notification about size about 50sec.
spinner.name: SWAP Selector

settingsPane.description: ZRAM control module takes real RAM and compress it by 40% to create more FREE RAM for apps! Compression method is LZ4. The more RAM is allocated in ZRAM, the more RAM is given to user at cost of CPU power and faster battery discharging. When switching ZRAM size from one to another, decompression and new compression will take some TIME. In some cases that will take more than 2 min In that time, Dorimanx App will FREEZE. DO NOT PANIC! You can just switch to home and open synapse and watch how much memory is decompressed. Do not kill the app.
settingsPane.name: ZRAM

spinner.description: ZRAM size controller. The more you set here, the more free RAM you'll get in cost of CPU power. But it's really low usage and device is operating GREAT! This is memory based module, so storage is not killed over time. You can see how it works in synapse app! Before proceeding PLEASE read the instruction ABOVE!
spinner.name: ZRAM Selector

seekBar.description: Controls ZRAM/SWAP allocation. The higher value is set, then ZRAM/SWAP will be used more storage instead of real RAM, in order to give you more free RAM! It only cost is slight performance drop (Default: 50%).
seekBar.name: Swappiness

settingsPane.description: UKSM lets the hypervisor system to share identical memory pages amongst different processes. This increases power consumption, but improves memory.
settingsPane.name: UKSM

checkbox.description: UKSM Enable and Disable main switch (Default: ON).
checkbox.name: Ultra Kernel Samepage Merging
checkbox.label: UKSM Switch

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor power when screen is ON. You can set high or low operational power for scanning and sharing memory across apps (Default: Medium Power).
spinner.name: UKSM CPU AWAKE GOV

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor Power when screen is OFF. You can set high or low operational power for scanning and sharing memory across apps (Default: No Power).
spinner.name: UKSM CPU SLEEP GOV

seekBar.description: Lower we set, more ram we can gain at cost of slight performance (Default: 1000).
seekBar.name: UKSM Scan Delay Interval

settingsPane.description: Activate some scripts which automatically run in the background at the specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for CRON Tasks. If you set this OFF, then all tasks below will have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON Task Master Switch

button.description: Use this button to test, if this CRON Task service is ONLINE and supported! make sure main CRON task switch is ON.
button.name: Test CRON Task Service
button.label: Test CRON Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel and refresh the configuration. None that it will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON Resetter
button.label: CRON Reset

checkbox.description: Cron that clears file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and when more than 50% of your memory is used. This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every hour

checkbox.description: Cron that reset SystemUI memory usage and release locked RAM that cant be freed by kernel, SystemUI service will automatically restart after 5sec. and use from 70 to 90 MiB memory than before.
checkbox.name: Reset SystemUI
checkbox.label: Reset SystemUI every 02:00 AM

checkbox.description: Enable Trim of System, Data and Cache partitions every day at 10:00 PM to speed up NAND Read and Write Access Time. NOTE that screen will be AWAKE during the fstrim to prevent MMC crash, then if screen was OFF it's will be auto turned off. Some devices don't like to be trimmed, so if device get stuck after 10:00 PM, don't enable this.
checkbox.name: Trim every day 10:00 PM
checkbox.label: Trim every day at 10:00 PM

checkbox.description: Enable reclaiming RAM from apps. It's smart memory kernel feature used to take back all cached RAM from apps without killing them. It helps to maintain stable and fast device for a long time. Task will run in every 2 hours.
checkbox.name: Reclaime RAM from apps
checkbox.label: Reclaim RAM from apps in every 2 hours

checkbox.description: Enable restarting Google service to stop memory leaks and CPU nonstop activity. This is one of the MAIN LP RAM leak BUGS. Service gets stuck, drains RAM and force CPU to work nonstop. This option fixes that problem by restarting the service in every 3 hours.
checkbox.name: Google service restart
checkbox.label: Restart LP Google service in every 3 hours

checkbox.description: Enable Battery Calibration every week at SAT 6:00 AM, in order to correct wrong calculation or remaining charging time.
checkbox.name: Calibrate Battery every week
checkbox.label: Calibrate Battery Every Week

checkbox.description: Cron that updates AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00 AM, from official site. The cron will check if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script turns WIFI and DATA on, wait for connection and update and when it's finished, turns WIFI OFF. If there is no connection, an error will be written into the log. If you use other app for blocking adds, no need to use it.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron for DB Optimization every day at 3:00 AM only if CPU is resting (IDLE).
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00 AM

checkbox.description: Cron for clearing app cache every day at 4:00 AM only if CPU is resting (IDLE).
checkbox.name: Clean app cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00 AM

button.description: Check if CRON Task Jobs are done as requested. It will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test CRON Task Jobs
button.label: Test CRON Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Other customization settings.
settingsPane.name: apps

button.description: Touch here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take Max 2 minutes.
button.name: DB Optimization
button.label: DB Optimization

button.description: Touch here to see current SELINUX status (Default: OFF).
button.name: SELINUX Status Check
button.label: SELINUX Status Check

button.description: Touch here to Enable or Disable Selinux Driver. If selinux is OFF apps may get access to files in system but not changed them. With ROOT access they can (with or without selinux). If SELINUX is disabled (Default: set on boot) then life is good and all works with no problems with GSM connection or access permissions with different apps. When you push this button ONCE, kernel command line will be updated and current kernel will reinstall automatic. To see changes you'll need to REBOOT! Then you can check using check button above. WARNING some USER apps loose some or all data (mostly configurations) when permissions changed! Do backup before change selinux to ENABLE! When you'll reboot Dalvik Cache will be cleared out and kernel will reboot. Wait for apps to be optimized.
button.name: SELINUX ON/OFF Control
button.label: SELINUX Hard ON/OFF

spinner.description: Change your SELinux (Security-Enhanced Linux) status from Enforcing (policy is enforced) to Permissive (prints warnings instead of enforcing). ONCE YOU CHANGE TO ENFORCE! THIS CONTROL app WILL NEVER WORK AGAIN. Untill you'll reset profiles by deleting data-.dori folder and reboot device or run setenforce 0 or use some app to change selinux to permissive. Then go here and set Permissive.
spinner.name: SeLinux Control

settingsPane.description: Customize Auto backlight driver settings.
settingsPane.name: min Backlight Control

checkbox.description: Enable backlight override set.
checkbox.name: min Backlight Override Switch
checkbox.label: min Backlight Override Switch

seekBar.description: If backlight override switch is ON, set the min backlight value in dark places. If you feel that screen is too bright or too dark in order for change to take effect you need to make the screen brighter then set auto, and see if it gets darker or brighter than was on default. You can see live changes only if current LUX is above 60. (Default: min ROM value 60, equals only 3 present of backlight power).
seekBar.name: min Backlight Level

settingsPane.description: Congestion control controls traffic entry into a telecommunications network, to avoid congestive collapse by avoiding oversubscription by reducing the rate of packets.
settingsPane.name: TCP Algorithms

spinner.description: This algorithms controls the Data Transmission Protocol used by many Internet applications. It needs from user to investigate from net and check what's the BEST setting for him. If USER is lazy to read Google, leave it as default (Cubic or Bic depends on phone model).
spinner.name: Net Congestion Control

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings. Some devices can have a problem with connecting while using DHCP method and obtaining IP address. You can use button below to clean WiFi lease and try again or use static method obtaining IP.
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Sometimes when connecting using WiFi, DHCP method will failure on Android WiFi (stuck on obtaining IP address). This option will clean the lease!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Change GPS settings.
settingsPane.name: GPS

spinner.description: Set GPS Time Zone for faster GPS lock. Use your current time zone.
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Check for current GPS ZONE.
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS Zone Check

settingsPane.description: Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker. It needs ROOT permissions to do the job. To update the blocker, push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get update of newer definitions. If new ROM is installed, to use AD BLOCKER, push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT the device. To REMOVE it, use the REMOVE button and REBOOT the device.
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: Add or Update AD Blocker.
button.name: AD-B UPDATE or ADD
button.label: Update AD-B

button.description: Remove AD Blocker.
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: Remove AD-B

checkbox.description: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. If you put scripts in INIT.D and enable it, default SuperSu scripts will run on boot from INIT.D.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: Set the Fast Charge mode when MTP is used as USB connection method. You can force override charging mA limit. For doing this, just select manual option and set below the requested limit. If it's set ON, then default limit is 1200mA. Our hardware allows Max 1600mA, BUT some people have reported, that it's possible to get more than 1600mA. For making it work, disconnect charger from the phone before proceeding. Then set destinate value and connect charger. Note that battery is charging at constant current until the BOOST VOLTAGE is reached. Then, the current is progressively reduced until it reaches one quarter of it's Maximum.
settingsPane.name: Fast Charge Control

spinner.description: Select Fast Charge mode.
spinner.name: Force Fast Charge Switch

spinner.description: Set the Max allowed mA limit while using wall charger. It will take effect ONLY if Fast Charge Manual is set above.
spinner.name: Fast Charge mA Limit

button.description: Reset the battery fuel counter. If you suspect that battery counter is not showing the correct state, ask kernel for calibration. While using, battery's capacity can shrink. For ex. old the battery have only 60% of it's original capacity. Recalibration takes that value and declare that as new 100% capacity. It can't extend battery life but prevents wrong calculation of reaming energy.
button.name: Reset Battery Counter
button.label: Reset Battery Counter

settingsPane.description: Enable using Android phone as USB keyboard for your PC. Let's say you don't have a keyboard and you really need one. Disconnect USB, make sure you are in MTP mode, enable the mode, connect your phone via USB, get the app named USB KEYBOARD and have fun.
settingsPane.name: Android USB HID Device

spinner.description: Enable USB HID Device driver to control PC keyboard and mouse from phone. IT MUST BE IN MTP MODE (not LG Software)! or you'll get blue screen of death on your PC!
spinner.name: USB HID Device

settingsPane.description: Rooted ADB control, and Logcat control
settingsPane.name: Rooted ADB and logcat

spinner.description: Allow ROOTED ADB shell. No SU is needed. For developer needs (direct access to system via ADB) use DEV ROOTED ADB (Default: Protected ADB).
spinner.name: ADB Selector

spinner.description: Control to enable or disable logcat, logcat used to debug ROM services and apps, if you never used it, then keep it OFF, you get more battery and less CPU usage on idle.
spinner.name: Logcat ON/OFF

settingsPane.description: Sweep2Sleep function control.
settingsPane.name: Sweep2Sleep

checkbox.description: Enable Sweep2Sleep function, that allows to turn screen OFF by sweeping from right to left or backwards at the bottom of the screen (navigation bar). If you removed the soft buttons bar, then you have to turn this function OFF.
checkbox.name: Sweep2Sleep Control
checkbox.label: Sweep2Sleep

settingsPane.description: This script manipulates many kernel settings, based on chosen Dorimanx App profile + settings and screen state (ON/OFF) - we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings after disabling a tweak, you must reboot the device.
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable the background-process from CortexBrain. Disabling it means, losing the functions that sets different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: CortexBrain-Background-Process

button.description: Touch to see, if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

checkbox.description: Enable Memory-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable disable System-Tweak (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable disable Kernel-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable disable I/O-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Check what profile is in use right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: Check current profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Choose kernel profiles.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Profiles

button.description: Extreme Performance
button.name: Extreme Performance Profile
button.label: Extreme Performance

button.description: Battery Save
button.name: Battery Save Profile
button.label: Battery

button.description: Extreme Battery Save
button.name: Extreme Battery Save Profile
button.label: Extreme Battery

settingsPane.description: Backup or restore current profile after installing or updating kernel. Some settings will work only after reboot.
settingsPane.name: Profile Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup Dorimanx App User Settings.
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: Backup

button.description: Restore Dorimanx App User Settings.
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: Restore

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card.
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel, if a reboot or a freeze was performed and log was created with it's name part contains USELESS phase, then there is nothing to be done here. There is no need to upload it to thread for investigation. If you want to report something else, and there weren't any reboot or freeze, ignore the USELESS naming, and upload it for a closer look.
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for apps. Make sure that Logcat is Enabled before using this option. Remember, it's useless for kernel DEV and it's only needed for ROM DEV!
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: ROM-Logcat

settingsPane.description: Check for Kernel Update or Use DorimanX OTA App.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Update

button.description: Check for updates.
button.name: Kernel-Update
button.label: Kernel Update Check

settingsPane.description: Load (on boot) kernel modules that will add some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable CIFS Module. This will allow to use apps that can mount internal storage and publish it over network. User can access data and system files over the network, if it will work or not depends only on apps for this module. Take effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module
